properties.name: Heartbeat
properties.description: Fired periodically by the client to keep the connection alive.

properties.name: Identify
properties.description: Starts a new session during the initial handshake.

properties.name: Voice State Update
properties.description: Used to join/leave or move between voice channels.

properties.name: Resume
properties.description: Resume a previous session that was disconnected.

properties.name: Reconnect
properties.description: You should attempt to reconnect and resume immediately.

properties.name: Request Guild Members
properties.description: Request information about offline guild members in a large guild.

properties.name: Invalid Session
properties.description: The session has been invalidated. You should reconnect and identify/resume accordingly.

properties.name: Hello
properties.description: Sent immediately after connecting, contains the  heartbeat_interval  to use.

properties.name: Heartbeat ACK
properties.description: Sent in response to receiving a heartbeat to acknowledge that it has been received.

name: Gateway Close Event Codes

properties.value: We're not sure what went wrong. Try reconnecting?
You sent an invalid [Gateway opcode](#DOCS_TOPICS_OPCODES_AND_STATUS_CODES/gateway-gateway-opcodes) or an invalid payload for an opcode. Don't do that!
You sent an invalid [payload](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/sending-payloads) to us. Don't do that!
You sent us a payload prior to [identifying](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/identify).
The account token sent with your [identify payload](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/identify) is incorrect.
You sent more than one identify payload. Don't do that!
The sequence sent when [resuming](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/resume) the session was invalid. Reconnect and start a new session.
Woah nelly! You're sending payloads to us too quickly. Slow it down! You will be disconnected on receiving this.
Your session timed out. Reconnect and start a new one.
You sent us an invalid [shard when identifying](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/sharding).
The session would have handled too many guilds - you are required to [shard](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/sharding) your connection in order to connect.
You sent an invalid version for the gateway.
You sent an invalid intent for a [Gateway Intent](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/gateway-intents). You may have incorrectly calculated the bitwise value.

You sent a disallowed intent for a [Gateway Intent](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/gateway-intents). You may have tried to specify an intent that you [have not enabled or are not approved for](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/privileged-intents).

description: Our voice gateways have their own set of opcodes and close codes.

properties.name: Heartbeat ACK
properties.description: Sent to acknowledge a received client heartbeat.

properties.name: Hello
properties.description: Time to wait between sending heartbeats in milliseconds.

properties.name: Client Disconnect
properties.description: A client has disconnected from the voice channel

name: Voice Close Event Codes

properties.value: You sent an invalid [opcode](#DOCS_TOPICS_OPCODES_AND_STATUS_CODES/voice-voice-opcodes).
You sent a invalid payload in your [identifying](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/identify) to the Gateway.
You sent a payload before [identifying](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/identify) with the Gateway.
The token you sent in your [identify](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/identify) payload is incorrect.
You sent more than one [identify](#DOCS_TOPICS_GATEWAY/identify) payload. Stahp.
Your session is no longer valid.
Your session has timed out.
We can't find the server you're trying to connect to.
We didn't recognize the [protocol](#DOCS_TOPICS_VOICE_CONNECTIONS/establishing-a-voice-udp-connection-example-select-protocol-payload) you sent.
Channel was deleted, you were kicked, voice server changed, or the main gateway session was dropped. Should not reconnect.
The server crashed. Our bad! Try [resuming](#DOCS_TOPICS_VOICE_CONNECTIONS/resuming-voice-connection).
We didn't recognize your [encryption](#DOCS_TOPICS_VOICE_CONNECTIONS/encrypting-and-sending-voice).

description: Our API will return semantically valid HTTP response codes based on the success of your request. The following table can be used as a reference for response codes it will return.

name: HTTP Response Codes

properties.name: 200 (OK)
properties.value: The request completed successfully.

properties.name: 201 (CREATED)
properties.value: The entity was created successfully.

properties.name: 204 (NO CONTENT)
properties.value: The request completed successfully but returned no content.

properties.name: 304 (NOT MODIFIED)
properties.value: The entity was not modified (no action was taken).

properties.name: 400 (BAD REQUEST)
properties.value: The request was improperly formatted, or the server couldn't understand it.

properties.name: 401 (UNAUTHORIZED)
properties.value: The `Authorization` header was missing or invalid.

properties.name: 403 (FORBIDDEN)
properties.value: The `Authorization` token you passed did not have permission to the resource.

properties.name: 404 (NOT FOUND)
properties.value: The resource at the location specified doesn't exist.

properties.name: 405 (METHOD NOT ALLOWED)
properties.value: The HTTP method used is not valid for the location specified.

properties.name: 429 (TOO MANY REQUESTS)
properties.value: You are being rate limited, see [Rate Limits](#DOCS_TOPICS_RATE_LIMITS).

properties.name: 502 (GATEWAY UNAVAILABLE)
properties.value: There was not a gateway available to process your request. Wait a bit and retry.

properties.name: 5xx (SERVER ERROR)
properties.value: The server had an error processing your request (these are rare).

description: Along with the HTTP error code, our API can also return more detailed error codes through a `code` key in the JSON error response. The response will also contain a `message` key containing a more friendly error string. Some of these errors may include additional details in the form of [Error Messages](#DOCS_REFERENCE/error-messages) provided by an `errors` object.

properties.name: Invalid permissions
properties.description: You lack permissions to access the given resource.

properties.name: Invalid client ID
properties.description: An invalid OAuth2 application ID was used to authorize or authenticate with.

properties.name: Invalid origin
properties.description: An invalid OAuth2 application origin was used to authorize or authenticate with.

properties.name: Invalid token
properties.description: An invalid OAuth2 token was used to authorize or authenticate with.

properties.name: Invalid user
properties.description: The specified user ID was invalid.

properties.name: OAuth2 error
properties.description: A standard OAuth2 error occurred; check the data object for the OAuth2 error details.

properties.name: Select channel timed out
properties.description: An asynchronous  SELECT_TEXT_CHANNEL / SELECT_VOICE_CHANNEL  command timed out.

properties.name: GET_GUILD  timed out
properties.description: An asynchronous  GET_GUILD  command timed out.

properties.name: Select voice force required
properties.description: You tried to join a user to a voice channel but the user was already in one.

properties.name: Capture shortcut already listening
properties.description: You tried to capture more than one shortcut key at once.

properties.name: Invalid client ID
properties.description: You connected to the RPC server with an invalid client ID.

properties.name: Invalid origin
properties.description: You connected to the RPC server with an invalid origin.

properties.name: Token revoked
properties.description: The OAuth2 token associated with a connection was revoked, get a new one!

properties.name: Invalid version
properties.description: The RPC Server version specified in the connection string was not valid.

properties.name: Invalid encoding
properties.description: The encoding specified in the connection string was not valid.
